title: The Famous Flower of Serving Men
description: The Famous Flower of Serving Men by Rachel McDonough is a novelisation of a famous folk song of the same name. Penned in 1656, "The Famous Flower of Serving Men" (Child Ballad 106) is an epic song of romance, deception and revenge. With this novel, Rachel McDonough sought to expand upon this centuries-old story, adding mystery and humanity to the historic murder ballad and weaving in elements from several other ballads. After years of studying and performing Renaisssance ballads, particularly the English and Scottish border songs in the Child Ballad Index. Rachel brings to life some of the remarkable stories chronicled in these songs, transforming the tale of young Elinor from the realm of myth to a deeply personal, if magic-tinged reality.
author: Rachel McDonough
